conclusion: Snell's Law relates angle of incidence, angle of refraction, and refractive indices.
Angle of refraction β1 is greater than β2 for the same angle of incidence θ.
Greater angle of refraction (β1 > β2) indicates a higher refractive index of the second medium.
Concentration of sucrose water is directly proportional to its refractive index.
Refractive index of sucrose water in glass A is higher than in glass B.
Concentration of sucrose water in glass A is higher than in glass B.
Final answer: No, the concentration of sucrose water in cup A is not higher.
